author: More Dispatches: nytimes.com/cityroom
body: EVERY once in a while at the Dog 'n Cat House, a pet grooming business in Ozone Park, Queens, the doorbell will ring when no one seems to be outside. The women who work there, attending to poodles and fluffy lap dogs, do not flinch, a receptionist named Beatrice said the other day. ''We just say, 'Hi, John,' '' she added with a laugh. John, in this
title: DISPATCHES; Married, in a Way, to the Mob
